title: Describe power of test for driver speeding ticket

content.description:
A police officer uses a motion detector to indicate whether a car is traveling faster than the speed limit (speeding). A speeding ticket will be issued to the driver of the car if the officer believes the driver is speeding, as indicated by the detector. The situation is similar to using a null and an alternative hypothesis to decide whether to issue a ticket. The hypotheses can be stated as follows.

H0 : The driver is not speeding.

Ha : The driver is speeding.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the power of the test?

choices.label: The probability of issuing a ticket to a driver who is speeding
The probability of issuing a ticket to a driver who is not speeding
The probability of not issuing a ticket to a driver who is speeding
The probability of not issuing a ticket to a driver who is not speeding
The probability that the motion detector is working correctly

content.answer: The probability of issuing a ticket to a driver who is speeding
